results.text: You apply your stellar sense of direction to the present situation. You may reliably retrace your steps for a distance up to the last mile you have traveled without getting lost or having to roll.
When you next use Survival to forage for edible plants, fungi, or insects, you gather twice as much as you would normally.
For the next 24 hours, you always know which direction is north, even if you are underground or on a different plane of existence.
You may simultaneously track a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus. This bonus lasts until you complete a long rest.
You expertly eliminate any signs that you and your allies were around. For the next hour, creatures attempting to track you by sight roll their checks at disadvantage.

You see something glint out of the dirt or dust—signs of something that fell out of someone else’s pocket along the road. Roll [[/r 1d12 #1d12]] and consult the 75 Gold Valuables table (Trials and Treasures, page 184) to determine the trinket you find.
